lines.gurmukhi: jau koaU mvws swiD BUmIAw imlwvY Awin qw pir pRsMn hoq inrK nirMd jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jau Kooo Mavaas Saadhi Bhoomeeaa Milaavai Aani , Taa Pari Prasann Hot Nirakh Narind Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: If a brave warrior defeats a rebel landlord and brings him into the protection of the king, the king rewards him out of happiness and glory is bestowed upon him.

lines.gurmukhi: jau koaU niRpiq BiRiq Bwig BUmIAw pY jwie Dwie mwrY BUmIAw sihiq hI rijMd jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jau Kooo Nripati Bhriti Bhaagi Bhoomeeaa Pai Jaai , Dhaai Maarai Bhoomeeaa Sahiti Hee Rajind Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: But if an employee of the king absconds the king and joins the rebel landlord, the king launches a campaign against him and kills both the rebel landlord as well as the disloyal servant.

lines.gurmukhi: Awn ko syvk rwj duAwr jwie soBw pwvY syvk nrys Awn duAwr jwq inMd jI
lines.transliteration_english: Aan Ko Sayvak Raaj Duaar Jaai Sobhaa Paavai , Sayvak Narays Aan Duaar Jaat Nind Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: If someone's employee takes refuge of the king, he earns praise there. But if a servant of the king goes to someone, he earns slander from all around.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gurisK Awn Anq srin gur Awn n smrQ gurisK pRiqibMd jI ]464]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gursikh Aan Anat Sarani Gur , Aan N Samarad Gursikh Pratibind Jee ?464?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, if a devotee of some god/goddess comes to the True Guru as a devoted disciple, the True Guru bless him with His refuge, initiates him in the meditation of His name. But no god or goddess is capable of granting refuge to any devoted Sikh of the
